cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi SSE of Savannah, Georgia
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then turning NNE/NE, skirting the Georgia and South Carolina coasts toward southern North Carolina before moving back out over the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of Charleston, South Carolina (coastal scrape rather than a direct inland landfall)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Surf City NC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning north of Fernandina Beach FL to Surf City NC; Tropical Storm Warning north of Surf City NC to Duck NC and north of Flagler/Volusia county line FL to Fernandina Beach FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeast Florida through Georgia, South Carolina and southern North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts (40–50 mph) early on 7 Oct, then quickly subsiding
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge 1–2 ft possible, along with dangerous surf and rip currents
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain totaling roughly 1–3 inches; heavier totals remain well north of the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and hazardous marine conditions that can disrupt vessel traffic
